com.percussion.search.objectstore
Class PSWSSearchParams

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.search.objectstore.PSWSSearchParams

public class PSWSSearchParams
extends Object

Class to represent the SearchParams element of the document created from a PSWSSearchRequest object. See toXml(Document) for more information.

getTitle

public PSWSSearchField getTitle()
Get the system title search field if one has been set.

Returns:
The field, may be null, never empty.

setTitle

public void setTitle(String title,
                     int op,
                     int connector)
Set the system title to search for.

Parameters:
title - The title, null or empty to clear it.
op - The operator, one of the PSWSSearchField.OP_ATTR_XXX values. Ignored if title is null.
connector - The connector to use with other search field criteria, one of the PSWSSearchField.OP_CONN_XXX values. Ignored if title is null. *

public long getContentTypeId()
Get the content type id to search for. See setContentTypeId(long) for more info.

Returns:
The content type id. A value of -1 indicates not to search on this property.

Set the content type id to search for.

Parameters:
contentTypeId - The content type id, must be greater than or equal to 0, or -1 to clear it.

getSearchFields

public List<PSWSSearchField> getSearchFields()
Get the search criteria for all fields to search for.

Returns:
A read-only list of PSWSSearchField objects, never null, may be empty.

getSearchFieldsByType

public List<PSWSSearchField> getSearchFieldsByType(boolean external)
Convenience method to get only internal or external search fields. See PSWSSearchField.isExternal() for more information.

Parameters:
external - true to get external fields, false to get internal fields.
Returns:
The list of PSWSSearchField objects, never null, may be emtpy. The caller takes ownership of the list.

getContentTypes

public String getContentTypes()
Get the content types to search for as a comma separated string of content type ids.

Returns:
the content type ids to search for or null if the search is not limited by content types.

setSearchFields

public void setSearchFields(List searchFields)
Set the search criteria for all fields to search for.

Parameters:
searchFields - A list of PSWSSearchField objects, never null, may be empty. A shallow copy of the list is stored in this object.

getResultFields

Get the field names to include in the search results.

Returns:
A read-only collection of the field names as String objects, never null, may be empty.

setResultFields

public void setResultFields(Collection resultFields)
Set the field names to include in the search results.

Parameters:
resultFields - A collection of field names as String objects, never null, may be empty. A copy of the collection is stored in this object.

Returns:
A read-only map of the properties.

setProperties

public void setProperties(Map<String,String> props)
Set the properties to pass thru to the search engine.

Parameters:
props - The properties, where the key is the property name and the value is the property value, both as String objects. May not be null. A shallow copy of the map is stored in this object.

setStartIndex

public void setStartIndex(int start)
Set the start index of results to return, inclusive. Initially 1 if never set.

Parameters:
start - The start index, must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the end index if set (see setEndIndex(int)).

getStartIndex

public int getStartIndex()
Get the start index. See setStartIndex(int) for more info.

Returns:
The start index.

setEndIndex

public void setEndIndex(int end)
Set the end index of results to return, inclusive. Initially -1 if never set, which indicates all results should be returned.

Parameters:
end - The end index, -1 to include all results, or else must be greater than 0 and greater than or equal to the start index (see setStartIndex(int)).

getEndIndex

public int getEndIndex()
Get the end index. See setEndIndex(int) for more info.

Returns:
The end index.

getFolderPathFilter

public String getFolderPathFilter()
See setFolderPathFilter(String, boolean) for details.

Returns:
Returns the value set by setFolderPathFilter(String, boolean). If no path is set, null is returned. Never empty.

setFolderPathFilter

public void setFolderPathFilter(String folderPathFilter,
                                boolean includeSubFolders)
This property allows the caller to limit the scope of their search to a folder tree. The following logical operations are performed if a path has been set:
  1. Perform the search using the standard criteria.
  2. Get all children of the folder specified by this path. Whether to recurse into sub-folders is determined by the isIncludeSubFolders() method.
  3. The result is the intersection.

Parameters:
folderPathFilter - null or empty to clear, otherwise a path to an existing folder in the Rx server or its folder id. The path is stored case-sensitive, but used case-insensitive for comparison purposes. No validation is performed now, it will be validated when the search request is made. Defaults to null.
includeSubFolders - If true, objects in the specified folder and any of its sub-folders are allowed in the search results. Otherwise, only objects in the top level folder are allowed. Defaults to true.

isIncludeSubFolders

public boolean isIncludeSubFolders()
See setFolderPathFilter(String, boolean) for details.

Returns:
Returns the value set with setFolderPathFilter(String, boolean).

isSearchForFolders

public boolean isSearchForFolders()
See setSearchForFolders(boolean) for details.

Returns:
Returns the value set with setSearchForFolders(boolean).

setSearchForFolders

public void setSearchForFolders(boolean searchForFolders)
This property controls whether folders will be included in the search results. This property works in conjunction w/ the folder path property. In other words, if that property is set, only folders that are in the specified folder tree will be returned.

Parameters:
searchForFolders - If true, then folders that match the search criteria will be included in the results, otherwise, no folder will be allowed in the result set.

toXml

public Element toXml(Document doc)
Serializes this object to its XML representation. See the sys_SearchParameters.xsd schema for details and the required format of the SearchParams element.

Parameters:
doc - The document to use, may not be null.
Returns:
The root element of the search request, never null.
